benchmark_details.name: BenchIEFL (BenchIE Full Annotation)
benchmark_details.overview: BenchIEFL is a new Open Information Extraction (OIE) benchmark created by re-annotating the existing BenchIE dataset to correct errors and improve annotation consistency and methodology.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a more reliable and accurate benchmark for evaluating Open Information Extraction systems, leading to better performance assessments on downstream tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark lacks a sufficient size for training models and is currently only available in English.

data.source: The benchmark is created from re-annotated sentences originally from BenchIE.
data.annotation: Annotations were performed manually following specific guidelines aimed at improving accuracy and consistency.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the new matching function which allows more flexible captures of valid extractions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment of extractions with the annotated tuples while considering the validation of tuples across various defined heuristics.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison results from state-of-the-art extractors such as ReVerb and MinIE, with BenchIEFL showing more accurate reflections of performance.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures included assessments from multiple expert annotators to ensure adherence to the benchmark guidelines.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: There is a lack of demographic breakdown in the dataset.
